TopicTitle: [1.12.X] Tantares - Stockalike Soyuz and MIR [16.1][28.05.2024][{Proton Revamp]

Articles.Content: any chance on that gradient?

any chance on that gradient?

I'm not quite sure what you mean?

It's quite easy, but also quite awkward if you don't have knowledge of the UV unwrap positions.

True. I've used a color-coded (think: red in one corner, blue in opposite, yellow and green in the others) to sniff out the general positions in the past (not in KSP yet though? (edit: once, for the stock radial monoprop tanks)). It takes some trial and error and a few passes (stepwise refinement of the color quads, etc), but is generally reliable. Still awkward though.

I'm not quite sure what you mean?

If you take a look at that, you'll see that the booster isn't a straight up slanted cone, but has different angles of slant in different parts. hence, they have a gradient

Hey the LK can land on Phobos, that's good, right?

True. I've used a color-coded (think: red in one corner, blue in opposite, yellow and green in the others) to sniff out the general positions in the past (not in KSP yet though? (edit: once, for the stock radial monoprop tanks)). It takes some trial and error and a few passes (stepwise refinement of the color quads, etc), but is generally reliable. Still awkward though.

Ah, that takes me back to modding some games that really didn't want to be modded

http://interspacenews.com/Portals/3/Articles/images/soyuz.jpg

If you take a look at that, you'll see that the booster isn't a straight up slanted cone, but has different angles of slant in different parts. hence, they have a gradient

Ok! I understand now.

Yeah this is the plan, the current models are more "conceptual" kind of things to see how the texture stealing will work, and what balance the tanks have.

Thanks!

what visual pack do you use in all of your photos?

Vanilla EVE

Edit: Oh, but I gave Kerbin a yellow smog layer.

For the MIR parts, will any of them have the thermal blanket texture on them similar to your ATV.

Probably not, sorry to say.

The thermal textures are really time consuming, and I'm still not all too happy with the look of the ATV.

A Lighter coloured (closer to the real MIR colour) alternate texture might be possible, however!

Thanks!

Edited September 10, 2014 by Darth Lazarus

you dont get it right?

you can ask friendly a modder to make something. but you are DEMANDING him to do so... and thats rude

I'm not demanding him to make something. When did I ever say the word make? I just told him to look at it for an idea. And the purpose of the raduga fits his needs perfectly. A modified hamal pod where you slip the container into it with all your science and send it back to kerbin. I never told him to make it. I told him to look at it for an idea.

I'm not demanding him to make something. When did I ever say the word make? I just told him to look at it for an idea. And the purpose of the raduga fits his needs perfectly. A modified hamal pod where you slip the container into it with all your science and send it back to kerbin. I never told him to make it. I told him to look at it for an idea.

I have a feeling English isn't your first language so what you wrote may sound fine to you but come off wrong for other people.

You wrote the following:

Beale, you gotta take my advice. Look at this pace for an idea for recovering science:http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/VBK-Raduga

It reads as pretty demanding because you wrote "you gotta take my advice".

What you should have said was:

Check out this awesome idea for recovering science:http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/VBK-Raduga

Or even:

This is an awesome idea for recovering science:http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/VBK-Raduga

Regardless, it is a interesting concept. I know I wouldn't mind something similar for retrieving science from the Station Science mod.
